channel.title: Some issues
channel.description:
Publicly, you can legally copy 10% of something copywritten or 30 seconds of content whichever is longest, and use it in your own product.
Privately, you can make a complete copy of anything you want for yourself, legally. (If you file it on claims as a backup.)
Legally, the user-agreement policy on jagex is binding. Detection of cheaters starts before you even log in the game!
Don't believe me? Look at the detail select page... Oh wow, there's an image map. Did you notice it's a server-side imagemap? Hope so.
This is one of the many reasons I can tell you your bot is detected without ever seeing it.

item.title: Some issues
item.dc:creator: @Krichevskoy Krichevskoy
item.description:
@Krichevskoy wrote:

pplsuqbawlz:

:-p It's not just an image map kiddo! There's more

I think that using the site to detect abnormal users might be a bit farfetched, but there are some things they could do I guess.
- Run some database-interactive script to set a hypothetical "logged_from_site" flag on your character
- Check referrer, user-agent, cookies, etc.
- Flag users of unsigned client in general
- Compare last few minutes of hits to their site with IP of game logins

Read full topic

item.title: Some issues
item.dc:creator: @pplsuqbawlz pplsuqbawlz
item.description:
@pplsuqbawlz wrote:

:-p It's not just an image map kiddo! There's more

item.title: Some issues
item.dc:creator: @Pwnd Pwnd
item.description:
@Pwnd wrote:

sdouble:

I just loooked at download.com to see how many times swiftswitch has been downloaded, it shows ~ 65,000 people have downloaded it from there since September. I'm assuming most people just download it from the official site or through the built in updater. I'm betting there are at least 200,000 installations that are used regularly. Do you think they can tell the difference between the world switchers and the bots just by loading?

I've downloaded it about.... Five times since September from download.com. So.... Yeah ;D

Read full topic

item.title: Some issues
item.dc:creator: @sdouble sdouble
item.description:
@sdouble wrote:

pplsuqbawlz:

Actually it wasnt confirmed legal by jagex.

Mod ashley said she thinks it is ok.

Andrew made a final statement that you were to use the site by the guidelines specified in the user agreement... That means no loaders like swiftswitch.

Mod ashley apalogized. No, you're not supposed to use any loaders.

I'm not saying they'll ban you for using a loader, I'm simply saying you're not supposed to.

I'm also saying they know when you do use a loader.

I suppose I went too far when I said "legal." I guess "OK" would have been better suited. I told my brother about swiftswitch a while back and he was afraid of getting banned with it, so I investigated this furthur. Here are some images on the FAQs on swiftswitch.net




I just loooked at download.com to see how many times swiftswitch has been downloaded, it shows ~ 65,000 people have downloaded it from there since September. I'm assuming most people just download it from the official site or through the built in updater. I'm betting there are at least 200,000 installations that are used regularly. Do you think they can tell the difference between the world switchers and the bots just by loading?

Read full topic

item.title: Some issues
item.dc:creator: @PaulT PaulT
item.description:
@PaulT wrote:

I take pride in the fact that I know Jagex knows more than me, and probably knows more about me than I know about me.

But once you accept that, it's like a load off your mind; They know what I'm up to, and I know what they're up to (figuring out what I'm up to).

Read full topic

item.title: Some issues
item.dc:creator: @sdouble sdouble
item.description:
@sdouble wrote:

SwiftSwitch is just a browser client that has been confirmed legal by Jagex. It skips the detail select page and the world select page by loading the login page without their redirects. Jagex accepts this and says it's fine.

So if a bot was to do that and then load itself, would it make it less detectable?

I'm just throwing it out there so if anyone else reads this, they have more to think about. =]

Read full topic
